title.narrative: Yemen: Targeted country assistance
Yémen (le): Aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

title.narrative: Partners' engagement framework

description.narrative: Through the partners’ engagement framework, Vaccine Alliance partners support countries’ immunisation activities

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: WHO : Human Resources for Health
More than 80% staff trained on the vaccination policy for the unimmunized children during 2nd year of life

target.value: Provide technical support to increase coverage of MCV2, and using 2YL platform to reduce number of unimmunized children

comment.narrative: 3 IOR rounds conducted in North and 2 in South till date in 2021, with one more planned before end of the year. Efforts ongoing to find resources from EMRO for conducting a 5th round. As well measles outbreak response vaccination campaign in 38 districts in North before end of the year will improve measles coverage and children immunity

title.narrative: At least 50% of data clerks recruited for governorate level trained

target.value: Provide technical support to train the data related staff of MoPH especially the one supposed to be recruited at governorate level under HSS3

comment.narrative: Activity delayed related to HSS3 that will start once funds received in country

title.narrative: All data clerks currently working with EPI at central level are fully trained.

target.value: Provide technical support for 1) Reporting on EPI performance and VPD surveillance 2) Capacity building activities of existing data clerks at central level

comment.narrative: All staff have been trained including turn over staff for national training ToT and on job trainings.

title.narrative: 1) Annual National Plan of Action will be developed and 2) micro planning tools revised and piloted

target.value: Provide technical support to the MoPH at central and governments for planning to develop annual work plan continuously do risk assessment to identify low coverage areas, predicting outbreaks due to VPDs and supporting mitigation measures as well planning and implementation of outbreak response activities

comment.narrative: Annual work plan developed and implemented with some delays in activities. Micro planning tool revised, training material developed and piloted. Quarterly risk assessment carried out with MoPH team especially for AFP surveillance and Measles. Outbreak response vaccination activities where possible and vaccine as well operational cost available otherwise limited response activities conducted.

title.narrative: At least 50% of the health facilities have EPI micro plan developed

target.value: Provide technical support to the MoPH at central and governments for planning to develop annual work plan continuously do risk assessment to identify low coverage areas, predicting outbreaks due to VPDs and supporting mitigation measures as well planning and implementation of outbreak response activities

comment.narrative: Annual work plan developed and implemented with some delays in activities. Micro planning tool revised, training material developed and piloted. Quarterly risk assessment carried out with MoPH team especially for AFP surveillance and Measles. Outbreak response vaccination activities where possible and vaccine as well operational cost available otherwise limited response activities conducted.

title.narrative: Analysis of areas with high number of children due for MR2 but not vaccinated

target.value: Provide technical support to increase coverage of MCV2, and using 2YL platform to reduce number of unimmunized children

comment.narrative: Country data team is doing analysis of children by district and governorate to provide information on areas with high number of children who have not received MCV2 vaccine. Four rounds of integrated outreach were conducted in some key governorates in the North to vaccinate children with MR2 as well other EPI antigens. Integrated supervision rounds conducted by central and governorate level supervisors to monitor vaccination activities and provide on the job training to the vaccinators. MLM training conducted and it is hoped that it will have also positive impact on the overall vaccination coverage including MCV2 during 2nd year of life. Further efforts will be made once the HSS3 support will eb made available to the country

title.narrative: Districts & Governorates with highest number of zero dose children identified

target.value: Enhancing knowledge and skills of vaccinators through a capacity building /refresher training in priority districts having higher number of Zero dose children. The data team at country level will start regular analysis of zero dose children and where these are concentrated on quartelry basis and share the informtaion with MoPH for appropriate action. In addition to capcity building other activities like micro plan revision, enhancing supervision and focussed vaccination activities including regular outreah and considering PIRI

comment.narrative: Country data team with support of VPI EMRO team is doing analysis of children by district and governorate to provide information on areas with high number of zero dose children. Four rounds of integrated outreach were conducted in some key governorates in the North with high zero dose children and provided all EPI antigens. Around 1,000 Integrated supervision visits conducted by central and governorate level supervisors to monitor vaccination activities in the districts and health facilities and provided on the job training to the vaccinators. MLM training conducted for 65 central and governorate staffs and more than 200 district EPI officers of the priority districts. However, additional planned trainings were not conducted and are to be implemented once the HSS3 support will be made available to the country

target.value: Enhancing knowledge and skills of vaccinators through a capacity building /refresher training in priority districts having higher number of Zero dose children. The data team at country level will start regular analysis of zero dose children and where these are concentrated on quartelry basis and share the informtaion with MoPH for appropriate action. In addition to capcity building other activities like micro plan revision, enhancing supervision and focussed vaccination activities including regular outreah and considering PIRI

comment.narrative: Data team has started identification of zero doses cases but yet concrete steps to be taken to access these children. Discussions with SCF and ICRC Yemen held but plans still to be materialized

title.narrative: 80% of EPI vaccinators in priority districts have received refresher training

target.value: Enhancing knowledge and skills of vaccinators through a capacity building /refresher training in priority districts having higher number of Zero dose children. The data team at country level will start regular analysis of zero dose children and where these are concentrated on quartelry basis and share the informtaion with MoPH for appropriate action. In addition to capcity building other activities like micro plan revision, enhancing supervision and focussed vaccination activities including regular outreah and considering PIRI

comment.narrative: Country data team with support of VPI EMRO team is doing analysis of children by district and governorate to provide information on areas with high number of zero dose children. Three rounds of integrated outreach in key governorates in North and two rounds in South were conducted with high zero dose children in 2021 so far. One more round planned to be conducted before end of the year

title.narrative: NDVP plan refined for each phase of implementation according to vaccine availability.

target.value: Provide technical support in planning and development of National Deployment & vaccine plan for COVID vaccine

comment.narrative: NDVP developed and rolled out. Vaccination started for the elderly, Health care workers and those with medical conditions in the South from 20th May 2021 in phase 1 after receiving the 360,000 AstraZeneca vaccine from COVAX facility. Whereas in the North only HCW will be reached in phase one and the vaccination is supposed to start after mid-June 2021 separate report submitted under the COVAX TA portal

title.narrative: At least 80% of monthly EPI coverage dashboards and 80% of the VPDs weekly reports are generated and shared

target.value: Provide technical support for 1) Reporting on EPI performance and VPD surveillance 2) Capacity building activities of existing data clerks at central level

comment.narrative: Ongoing technical support to MoPH data staff on VPDs surveillance data/ outbreaks and routine EPI as well SIAs related to vaccine preventable diseases.

title.narrative: Target population vaccinated achieveing on average 70% coverage for each round

target.value: Provide technical support in planning and development of National Deployment & vaccine plan for COVID vaccine

comment.narrative: Providd technical support in development of national vaccine deployment plan and strategies to vaccinate target population. As of October 2021 total of 886,000 doses of vaccines were recieved and morethan 552,000 beneficiaries recieved at least one dose of either AstraZeneca or Janssen vaccine. Vaccination is not authorized in the North and the absorption is slow in the South. Activities are ongoing to enhance uptake in collaboration with IDPs, Ministry of Education and other stakeholders.

title.narrative: At least 2 sentinel sites (1 in Sana'a and 1 in Aden) established

target.value: Provide technical assistance for 1) establishment of 3 sentinel sites for congenital rubella syndrome 2) sensitization / awareness of health care providers about VPDs 3) provision of lab reagents / equipment's to CPHL.

comment.narrative: Regular technical support provided to labs in the form of refresher trainings as well operational support in terms of staff incentives, Lab reagents and equipment's provided under HSS2. Delay in establishment of 3 Sentinel sites for CRS as the activity is related to HSS3 that will start once HSS3 funds received in country

title.narrative: 25% of Health care providers in public hospitals have participated in VPDs awareness meetings.

target.value: Provide technical assistance for 1) establishment of 3 sentinel sites for congenital rubella syndrome 2) sensitization / awareness of health care providers about VPDs 3) provision of lab reagents / equipment's to CPHL.

comment.narrative: Sensitization sessions completed for the health care providers in 100% of governorates and various lab reagents procured and provided to the Central Public Health for various VPDs related tests. However, the sentinel sites for congenital Rubella syndrome has yet to materialize as support for this is available through HSS3 funds which has yet to be released

title.narrative: At least 2 out of the 4 planned Integrated Outreach rounds conducted

target.value: Improve the managerial skills of governorates and district level managers through mid level management on the job Refresher training based on the observations and defeciencies identified during supervisory visit. Supporting Implementation of Integrated Outreach to vaccinate the children in remote & Hard to reach areas, marginalized communities including IDPs, Migrants and refugees/returnees

comment.narrative: Three IOR rounds conducted in North and two in South whereas one more round planned to be conducted before end of the year. 2,808 Integrated Supervisor conducted from Central and governorate level

title.narrative: WHO
23 of governorate annual microplan will be developed

target.value: Provide technical support to the government for planning

comment.narrative: Annual work plan developed and implemented with some delays in activities. Micro planning tool revised, training material developed and piloted. Quarterly risk assessment carried out with MoPH team especially for AFP surveillance and Measles. Outbreak response vaccination activities where possible and vaccine as well operational cost available otherwise limited response activities conducted.

title.narrative: at least 2164 of integrated supervisory visitis will be done from governorate level and 2275 from district level

target.value: Establish technical unit and conduct integrated supervision from all levels (HSS activity 1.4).

comment.narrative: Around 1,000 Integrated supervision visits conducted by central and governorate level supervisors to monitor vaccination activities in the districts and health facilities and provided on the job training to the vaccinators. MLM training conducted for 65 central and governorate staffs and more than 200 district EPI officers of the priority districts.

title.narrative: The technical unit will be established and 1231 integrated supervisory visits will be done from central level

target.value: Establish technical unit and conduct integrated supervision from all levels (HSS activity 1.4).

comment.narrative: Around 1,000 Integrated supervision visits conducted by central and governorate level supervisors to monitor vaccination activities in the districts and health facilities and provided on the job training to the vaccinators.

title.narrative: One nationwide polio campaign will be conducted in the 1st quarter of 2020

target.value: Provide support in disease specific initiatives e.g. polio eradication, measles and NT elimination

comment.narrative: Campaign was delayed due to COVID pandemic as per WHO/UNICEF instructions to stop any SIAs and campaign was conducted in Southern governorates in July after introduction of WHO and UNICEF guidelines on resumption of SIAs including polio following Infection prevention and control Measures

title.narrative: At least 80% of lab reagents/equpments requested are provided

target.value: Provide technical assistance for 1) estabilshment of 3 sentinal sites for conjenital rubella syndrom 2) sensitization / awarness of health care providers about VPDs 3) provision of lab reagents / equipmnts to CPHL.

comment.narrative: More than 80% of the required Lab reagents were provided as MoPH request though with delays specially with the international supplies as the country is under embargo

title.narrative: WHO : Data
100% of Governorate district level data officers trained on COVID19 vaccination and RI data system including collection and aggregation of data using digital platform

target.value: G.2 Develop or adapt necessary monitoring tools or adapt existing tools: vaccination card/certificate - facility-based nominal registers and/or tally sheets, vaccination reports (paper and/or electronic) and analytical tools to monitor progress and coverage among different at-risk categories

comment.narrative: Data collection tools were adapted to include COVID19 vaccination including registration book, vaccination card and reporting forms. Electronic vaccination certification was launced and is in use . monitoring of coverage is done using online dashboard which disaggregate achievemnet by district, gender and other variables. In addition, all district level data officers were trined on COVID19 vaccination data management and since July 2021 they are using electronic reporting in parallel with paper forms.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity

1) At least 75% of the year one procurement completed and delivered to the Ministry. 2) At least two spot check conducted on HSS units on GAVI grant and capacity of the finance officers built in the process

target.value: Support the MoPHP management of HSS3 grant and implementation of activities on the grant and support the implementation of GAVI grant Managment requirement (GMR) 1) Support all procurement related activities on HSS3 2) Support the management and implementation of incentive payment on HSS3. 3) Support monitoring and supportive supervision of Immunization activities at central, governorate, districts and HF levels 4} Support the MoPHP in design, printing and distribution of asset register and use of same for GAVI supported assets managment 5) Support conduct of financial spot checks and program monitoring visits on GAVI HSS units in MoPHP

comment.narrative: HSS3 could not take off in 2020 due to significant delay with budget finalization as a result no procurement on HSS3 could not take took place during the reporting period. The HSS3 implementation is planned to commence in August 2021 and hopefully all related procurement could commence

target.value: Support the MoPHP management of HSS3 grant and implementation of activities on the grant and support the implementation of GAVI grant Managment requirement (GMR) 1) Support all procurement related activities on HSS3 2) Support the management and implementation of incentive payment on HSS3. 3) Support monitoring and supportive supervision of Immunization activities at central, governorate, districts and HF levels 4} Support the MoPHP in design, printing and distribution of asset register and use of same for GAVI supported assets managment 5) Support conduct of financial spot checks and program monitoring visits on GAVI HSS units in MoPHP

comment.narrative: HSS3 could not take off in 2020 due to significant delay with budget finalization as a result no procurement on HSS3 could not take took place during the reporting period. The HSS3 implementation is planned to commence in August 2021 and hopefully all related procurement could commence

title.narrative: WHO : Health Information Systems (Data)
80% of the activities included in the data quality improvement plan are implemented

target.value: Provide technical support for implementing data quality improvement plan

comment.narrative: DQAs could not be conducted due to the prevailing security situation, COVID pandemic and delay in processing LTA. In consultation with MoPHP and with Gavi approval, funds used for the integrated vaccination strategy in Sa'adah having cVDPV, Diphtheria and Measles outbreaks. So the reprogrammed activity completed

target.value: Provide technical support for implementing data quality improvement plan

comment.narrative: DQAs could not be conducted due to the prevailing security situation, COVID pandemic and delay in processing LTA. In consultation with MoPHP and with Gavi approval, funds used for the integrated vaccination strategy in Sa'adah having cVDPV, Diphtheria and Measles outbreaks. So the reprogrammed activity completed

title.narrative: 50% of the activities included in the data quality improvement plan are implemented

target.value: Provide technical support for implementing data quality improvement plan

comment.narrative: DQAs could not be conducted due to the prevailing security situation, COVID pandemic and delay in processing LTA. In consultation with MoPHP and with Gavi approval, funds used for the integrated vaccination strategy in Sa'adah having cVDPV, Diphtheria and Measles outbreaks. So the reprogrammed activity completed

title.narrative: At least 80% of the governorates have updated monitoring charts and data reports archived.

target.value: Improve the capacity of MoH data staff in different levels in terms of data accurecy, data archiving and data compilation/analysis.

comment.narrative: Ongoing technical support to MoPH data staff on VPDs surveillance data/ outbreaks and routine EPI as well SIAs related to vaccine preventable diseases. Data is received from 100% of governorates through MoPH with completeness rate of 99% for 2020 for district reports. Data is analyzed quarterly and feedback provided for necessary corrections and follow up action. Dashboard produced for surveillance, routine EPI and SIAs that are made available at all levels.

target.value: Improve the capacity of MoH data staff in different levels in terms of data accurecy, data archiving and data compilation/analysis.

comment.narrative: Ongoing technical support to MoPH data staff on VPDs surveillance data/ outbreaks and routine EPI as well SIAs related to vaccine preventable diseases. Data is received from 100% of governorates through MoPH with completeness rate of 99% for 2020 for district reports. Data is analyzed quarterly and feedback provided for necessary corrections and follow up action. Dashboard produced for surveillance, routine EPI and SIAs that are made available at all levels.

target.value: Improve the capacity of MoH data staff in different levels in terms of data accurecy, data archiving and data compilation/analysis.

comment.narrative: Ongoing technical support to MoPH data staff on VPDs surveillance data/ outbreaks and routine EPI as well SIAs related to vaccine preventable diseases. Data is received from 100% of governorates through MoPH with completeness rate of 99% for 2020 for district reports. Data is analyzed quarterly and feedback provided for necessary corrections and follow up action. Dashboard produced for surveillance, routine EPI and SIAs that are made available at all levels.

target.value: Provide technical support for 1) Reporting on EPI performance and VPD surveillance 2) Hiring and training of data clerks in governorates and central

comment.narrative: All staff have been trained including turn over staff for national training ToT and on job trainings.

target.value: Provide technical support for 1) Reporting on EPI performance and VPD surveillance 2) Hiring and training of data clerks in governorates and central

comment.narrative: This milestone is linked to HSS3 plan and will be implemented as soon funds under HSS3 are available

title.narrative: At least 90% of health facilities have EPI microplan developed

target.value: Provide technical support to the MoPH at central and governments for planning

comment.narrative: Technical support provided to EPI staff at central and governorate level to update the facility and district level micro plans. Comprehensive PHC micro plan developed jointly by MoPH, UNICEF and WHO teams and are in use for routine services in more than 50% of the 4,000 health facilities with financial support from UNICEF through other funding sources

target.value: Provide technical support to the MoPH at central and governments for planning

Comprehensive PHC micro plan developed jointly by MoPH, UNICEF and WHO teams and are in use for routine services in more than 50% of the 4,000 health facilities with financial support from UNICEF through other funding sources

target.value: Enhancing knolwedg and skills of vaccinators through a capacity building /refresher training in the 66 priority districts

comment.narrative: This milestone is linked to HSS3 plan and will be implemented as soon funds under HSs3 are available.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Financial/General Management
2) Gavi approved incentive payment on HSS3 completed to at least 85% of the beneficiaries

target.value: Support the MoPHP on preparation and management of HSS3 grant and implementation of activities on the grant and support the implementation of GAVI grant Managment requirement (GMR) 1) Support all procurement related activities on HSS3 2) Support compilation of HSS programmatic report 3) Support set up of TPM arrangment for HSS activities 4) Support the management and implementation of approved incentive payment on HSS3. 5) Support monitoring and supportive supervision of Immunization activities at central, governorate, districts and HF levels 6) Support conduct of financial spot checks and program monitoring visits on GAVI HSS units in MoPHP

comment.narrative: The milestone was significantly delayed due to delays with both finalization of the HSS3 budget and commencement of the implementation of the support. The agreement between Gavi and UNICEF on the HSS3 support was only signed in early November 2021 and fund disbursement to the country is being processed excluding the HR component for incentives. This is because MoPHP is expected to submit relevant documents related to HR in the country to Gavi to inform the finalization of that component of the budget and subsequent disbursement to UNICEF for the payment of incentives. Perhaps this will be completed end of 2021 and payment will be in 2022

title.narrative: At least one spot check conducted on HSS units on GAVI grant and follow up actions and recommendation implemented

target.value: Support the MoPHP on preparation and management of HSS3 grant and implementation of activities on the grant and support the implementation of GAVI grant Managment requirement (GMR) 1) Support all procurement related activities on HSS3 2) Support compilation of HSS programmatic report 3) Support set up of TPM arrangment for HSS activities 4) Support the management and implementation of approved incentive payment on HSS3. 5) Support monitoring and supportive supervision of Immunization activities at central, governorate, districts and HF levels 6) Support conduct of financial spot checks and program monitoring visits on GAVI HSS units in MoPHP

comment.narrative: UNICEF continues to make efforts with conduct of HACT assurance activities. During the period of Jan-June 2021, three Program Monitoring Visits (PMVs) were conducted on HSS related activities and one spot check commissioned. The spot check delayed because the MoPHP did not grant the permission early enough but was recently completed and report being compiled by the third party. Recommendations will be follow up

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
At least 80% of 2020 CCEOP equipment deployment, installation and commission completed

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement effective Immunization supply chain managment. (1. Support development of quarterly vaccine distribution plan from the central to the governorate and governorate to the districts store and ensure availability of vaccine at district and HF levels 2) Support planning and implementation of Year one CCEOP deployment plan and the delinking process in CCEOP implementation 3) support the installation and commission of the walkin cold room in the 14 governorate. 4) Support the installation and commissioning of the RTMDs at central and governorate stores

comment.narrative: The CCEOP implementation was significantly delayed due to delayed agreement from the MoPHP to have the 20% country contribution from the HSS3. This was further delayed by delayed HSS3 budget finalization until Gavi decided to grant a partial approval for CCEOP component following the confirmation from the MoPHP to have the country contribution from the HSS3. CCEOP Equipment year 1 &;2 have been procured and being shipped currently to the country and deployment and installation to commence in Q3 of 2021

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement effective Immunization supply chain managment. (1. Support development of quarterly vaccine distribution plan from the central to the governorate and governorate to the districts store and ensure availability of vaccine at district and HF levels 2) Support planning and implementation of Year one CCEOP deployment plan and the delinking process in CCEOP implementation 3) support the installation and commission of the walkin cold room in the 14 governorate. 4) Support the installation and commissioning of the RTMDs at central and governorate stores

comment.narrative: The CCEOP implementation was significantly delayed due to delayed agreement from the MoPHP to have the 20% country contribution from the HSS3. This was further delayed by delayed HSS3 budget finalization until Gavi decided to grant a partial approval for CCEOP component following the confirmation from the MoPHP to have the country contribution from the HSS3. CCEOP Equipment year 1 &;2 have been procured and being shipped currently to the country and deployment and installation to commence in Q3 of 2021

title.narrative: 1). At least 50% of 2020 CCEOP equipment and 60% of the walkin cold room and RTMDs installed in 50% of the locations deployment, installation and comission completed

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement effective Immunization supply chain managment. (1. Support development of quarterly vaccine distribution plan from the central to the governorate and governorate to the districts store and ensure availability of vaccine at district and HF levels 2) Support planning and implementation of Year one CCEOP deployment plan and the delinking process in CCEOP implementation 3) support the installation and commission of the walkin cold room in the 14 governorate. 4) Support the installation and commissioning of the RTMDs at central and governorate stores

comment.narrative: There were delays with the country co investment to the CCEOP and subsequently finalization of the HSS3 budget. The procurement of the CCEOP equipment for year1&2 already completed and being shipped for deployment and installation in Q3. Two of the RTMD have been installed in the central cold store South and the North. The remaining are being followed up for installation at the selected governorate cold stores. 70% of the walk in cold rooms have been installed and operational in the governorate. the remaining two are being prepared for installation

title.narrative: Four pysical stock take conducted and reported by the central level and at least 90% of the governorates for 2019

target.value: Support supply chain Data for management and decision and introduction of new technology innovation in vaccine managment in the country. VSSM is currently in use at the central level and other levels engaged with manual record keeping for vaccine and supplies managment (1.Support vaccine supply planning and strengthening of regular VSSM update and use at central level, 2. Support monitoring of vaccine stock by quarterly physical stock take at central and governorate level.3) support quarterly cold chain inventory update and reporting from all districts, 4. Commence the use of Smart Child Application at central level and selected governorates following basic training

comment.narrative: UNICEF continued to support the MoPHP to have some oversight on stock situation across the immunization supply chain levels in the country and had the physical stock take conducted for the four quarters in 2020. The physical stock take is becoming challenging especially in the North where the MoPHP authority has stopped the activities of the cold chain and vaccine management consultants. This contributed to significant delays in getting Q4 stock report

target.value: Support supply chain Data for management and decision and introduction of new technology innovation in vaccine managment in the country. VSSM is currently in use at the central level and other levels engaged with manual record keeping for vaccine and supplies managment (1.Support vaccine supply planning and strengthening of regular VSSM update and use at central level, 2. Support monitoring of vaccine stock by quarterly physical stock take at central and governorate level.3) support quarterly cold chain inventory update and reporting from all districts, 4. Commence the use of Smart Child Application at central level and selected governorates following basic training

The physical stock take is becoming challenging especially in the North where the MoPHP authority has stopped the activities of the cold chain and vaccine management consultants. This contributed to significant delays in getting Q4 stock report

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
At least 80% of the VPD outbreaks investigated and responded

target.value: Provide technical support in identifying low coverage areas, predicting outbreaks and supporting mitigating measures

comment.narrative: As of June 2021, most if not all Outbreaks of Measles , Diphtheria and 34 cVDPV1 cases have been investigated and responded. Though with some delayed responses due to COVID pandemic, MoPH North hesitance for vaccination and availability of operational resources and vaccines

target.value: Provide technical support in identifying low coverage areas, predicting outbreaks and supporting mitigating measures

comment.narrative: As of June 2021, most if not all Outbreaks of Measles , Diphtheria and 34 cVDPV1 cases have been investigated and responded. Though with some delayed responses due to COVID pandemic, MoPH North hesitance for vaccination and availability of operational resources and vaccines

title.narrative: MCV2 coverage improved by at least 10% compared to 2019

target.value: Provide technical support to increase coverage of MCV2, and using 2YL platform to reduce number of unimmunized children

comment.narrative: 3 IOR rounds conducted in North and 2 in South as well measles outbreak response vaccination campaign will improve measles coverage and children immunity. The number of children receiving MR2 during Jan - Sep 2021 has increased to 448,416 (54%) compared to 354875 (44%) in 2020 though in 2021 4 governorates in South has not shared data for Q3

target.value: Provide technical support to increase coverage of MCV2, and using 2YL platform to reduce number of unimmunized children

comment.narrative: This was affected by COVID 19 pandemic. However, the country made effort by conducting 4 rounds of IOR to maintain MCV2 coverage at 54% in 2020 as well by vaccinating 579,751 in 2020 compared to 564,978 in 2019

target.value: Provide technical support to increase coverage of MCV2, and using 2YL platform to reduce number of unimmunized children

comment.narrative: This was affected by COVID 19 pandemic. However, the country made effort by conducting 4 rounds of IOR to maintain MCV2 coverage at 54% in 2020 as well by vaccinating 579,751 in 2020 compared to 564,978 in 2019

title.narrative: More than 80% staff trained on the vaccination policey for the unimmunized children during 2nd year of life

target.value: Provide technical support to increase coverage of MCV2, and using 2YL platform to reduce number of unimmunized children

comment.narrative: This was affected by COVID 19 pandemic. However, the country made effort by conducting 4 rounds of IOR to maintain MCV2 coverage at 54% in 2020 as well by vaccinating 579,751 in 2020 compared to 564,978 in 2019

title.narrative: UNICEF : Vaccine-Specific Support
At least 2 Physical stock take conducted at the central cold store and about 90% of the governoate and district conducted and reported at least 2 quarterly vaccine physical stock takes.

target.value: Support supply chain Data for management and decision . VSSM is currently in use at the central level and other levels engaged with manual record keeping for vaccine and supplies managment (1.Support vaccine supply planning and strengthening of regular VSSM update and use at central level, 2. Support monitoring of vaccine stock by quarterly physical stock take at central and governorate level.3) support cold chain inventory update and reporting from all districts, 4) Conduct Effective Vaccine Managment (EVM) Assessment

comment.narrative: Though challenging, UNICEF support the physical stock take for Q2 in July 2021 and Q3 in October 2021 at central and governorate levels

title.narrative: At least one Physical stock take conducted at the central cold store and 90% of the governoate and district conducted and reported at least one quarterly vaccine physical stock take

target.value: Support supply chain Data for management and decision . VSSM is currently in use at the central level and other levels engaged with manual record keeping for vaccine and supplies managment (1.Support vaccine supply planning and strengthening of regular VSSM update and use at central level, 2. Support monitoring of vaccine stock by quarterly physical stock take at central and governorate level.3) support cold chain inventory update and reporting from all districts, 4) Conduct Effective Vaccine Managment (EVM) Assessment

comment.narrative: UNICEF continues to support the MoPHP to have some oversight on stock situation across the immunization supply chain levels in the country. Q1 stock was submitted from 100% of the governorate and over 85% of the districts. The physical stock take is becoming challenging especially in the North where the MoPHP authority has stopped the activities of the cold chain and vaccine management consultants which delayed the Q1 stock report

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
At least 90% of the 13 walkin cold rooms installed and commissioned in the governorate and at least 80% of the RTMDs installed at the governorate cold stores

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement effective Immunization supply chain managment. (1. Support development of quarterly vaccine distribution plan from the central to the governorate and governorate to the districts store and ensure availability of vaccine at district and HF levels 2) Support planning and implementation of Year one CCEOP deployment plan and the delinking process in CCEOP implementation 3) support the installation and commission of the walkin cold room in the 13 governorate. 4) Support the installation and commissioning of the RTMDs at central and governorate stores

comment.narrative: UNICEF continues to support improvement in the vaccine storage capacity across the country. 10 of the 13 walk-in cold room have been installed and the installation for the eleventh unit will soon be completed. Installation of RTMD for the central store in the North and South is completed. Additional units of walk in cold rooms have been procured for other governorates and installation will be completed early in 2022.

title.narrative: 1) Immunization supply forecast for 2021 available in Q1 of 2021 and shipment plan developed for implementation in use

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement effective Immunization supply chain managment. (1. Support development of quarterly vaccine distribution plan from the central to the governorate and governorate to the districts store and ensure availability of vaccine at district and HF levels 2) Support planning and implementation of Year one CCEOP deployment plan and the delinking process in CCEOP implementation 3) support the installation and commission of the walkin cold room in the 13 governorate. 4) Support the installation and commissioning of the RTMDs at central and governorate stores

comment.narrative: Working with UNICEF supply division in collaboration with the MoPHP engaging MoPHP parameters, UNICEF country office supported the development of the 2021 immunization forecast which has been completed and shipment plan based on the plan developed and currently being implemented to ensure availability of vaccine in the country for immunization services

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Communities have access to information and IEC material

target.value: Support linking community to service component of Reaching Every Community 1) Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement effective Advocacy, Communication and Social Mobilization (ACSM) interventions at national, governorate and district levels. 2) Promote community access to and demand for Immunization services through community volunteers and other community networks with focus of the 66 Districts with low immunization coverage*. 3) Support the development and distribution of IEC materials to address rumors and improve uptake of vaccination 4) Support the development and implementation of plan to engage media including Radio, television and print media on immunization issues 5) Support capacity development in inter-personal communication (IPC) of Health workers to improve their skills in addressing refusals. 6) Mapping gatherings of migrants, IDPs and other special groups such as (CWDs) and mobilize them for immunization services.

comment.narrative: It is a continuous and routine work of UNICEF with MOPHP through community health networks; 12,000 Community Volunteers and Mother to mother club did routine awareness and visits to communities for conveying 5 main health messages including immunization using booklets and brochures printed by UNICEF to ensure people are still having health information. UNICEF have also developed washable fabric bags with health immunization messages and distributed to people in the south. There is also sustainable sharing of IEC materials via Social media

target.value: Support linking community to service component of Reaching Every Community 1) Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement effective Advocacy, Communication and Social Mobilization (ACSM) interventions at national, governorate and district levels. 2) Promote community access to and demand for Immunization services through community volunteers and other community networks with focus of the 66 Districts with low immunization coverage*. 3) Support the development and distribution of IEC materials to address rumors and improve uptake of vaccination 4) Support the development and implementation of plan to engage media including Radio, television and print media on immunization issues 5) Support capacity development in inter-personal communication (IPC) of Health workers to improve their skills in addressing refusals. 6) Mapping gatherings of migrants, IDPs and other special groups such as (CWDs) and mobilize them for immunization services.

comment.narrative: It is a continuous and routine work of UNICEF with MOPHP through community health networks; 12,000 Community Volunteers and Mother to mother club did routine awareness and visits to communities for conveying 5 main health messages including immunization using booklets and brochures printed by UNICEF to ensure people are still having health information. UNICEF have also developed washable fabric bags with health immunization messages and distributed to people in the south. There is also sustainable sharing of IEC materials via Social media

title.narrative: The 66 low immunization coverage Districts have community volunteers and other community networks to promote immunization uptake

comment.narrative: UNICEF had increased number of health community networks worked to promote demand of vaccines in the 66 high risk districts for the respective period: ?2924 Community volunteers (CV). ?2331 Community health and nutrition volunteers (CHNV) ?1028 Community midwives (CMW) ?384 Community health workers (CHWs). As part of UNICEF health community networks system to connect networks with supported health facilities for immunization services which is one of the Minimum services packages (MSP) especially in the 66 high risk districts. the above community networks worked to increase the demand of vaccines and promote immunization messages during their day-to-day activities, and they had a remarkable role on commemorating World immunization week (WIW) 2021. There are also other community networks which were established by UNCIEF via C4D section whose main TOR work is related to health education and promotion social mobilization such as Religious leaders (2177) and Mother-to-mother clubs (271). During this period CVs worked on the second phase of health education 5+1 messages including immunization. In Azal district, the report shows that vaccination messages had the highest rate of delivery.

title.narrative: Annual Demand promotion plan of action developed to accelerate immunization in the communities

comment.narrative: UNICEF support health education centers to put annual plans of social mobilization (SM) activities for immunization, including IOR and World Immunization week (WIW) commemoration. The plan is under implementation phase. UNICEF has activated health community networks (community health workers, Community midwives and Community Health & Nutrition Volunteers) to worked together for conveying unified immunization messages

title.narrative: UNICEF : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
At least 50% of the operational plan funded activities implemented

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement activities at the Governorate/district/sub district level with focus on Immunization coverage and equity 1) Support the development of integrated PHC microplan at Health facility level. 2) Support development of annual EPI operational plan for 2021

comment.narrative: Over 70% of activities funded on the 2021 EPI operational Plan of action (PoA) supported by UNICEF were implemented including immunization supply chain related activities, Demand generation activities, implementation of campaigns and integrated outreach and support to Covid-19 vaccine deployment in the country. Other activities funded which are yet to be completed are ongoing

title.narrative: At least 95% of the EPI taskforce and NITAG meetings supported and facilitated action points followed for implementation

target.value: Support MoPHP and participate in coordination/technical meeting with partners and CSO at country and Regional level contributing to issues advancing immunization coverage and equity 1) Participate in EPI Taskforce and Health System Strenghtening Coordination Committee meeting meeting, 2) Participate at the NITAG meeting 3) support coordination, planning and participate at the GAVI Joint Appraisal/MSD meeting 4) Support coordination and organization of teleconfrences with GAVI for updates

comment.narrative: The EPI taskforce meeting frequency has reduced in the last one year. However, UNICEF continues to be represented at each taskforce meeting both in the South and the North where immunization and related issues are discussed. 100% Four EPI taskforce and one NITAG meeting were attended in the North and not less than 3 EPI taskforce meeting in the South were attended amidst other adhoc meetings

title.narrative: Availability of 2021 EPI operational plan and implementation started

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement activities at the Governorate/district/sub district level with focus on Immunization coverage and equity 1) Support the development of integrated PHC microplan at Health facility level. 2) Support development of annual EPI operational plan for 2021

comment.narrative: UNICEF closely worked with WHO to put together operational plan for 2021 and this was shared with MoPHP in the North and South. Activities on the operational plan have since commenced implementation in the country

title.narrative: 100% of the organized teleconfrence meetings with GAVI and other partners supported and facilitated and action point followed for implementation

target.value: Support MoPHP and participate in coordination/technical meeting with partners and CSO at country and Regional level contributing to issues advancing immunization coverage and equity 1) Participate in EPI Taskforce and Health System Strenghtening Coordination Committee meeting meeting, 2) Participate at the NITAG meeting 3) support coordination, planning and participate at the GAVI Joint Appraisal/MSD meeting 4) Support coordination and organization of teleconfrences with GAVI for updates

comment.narrative: UNICEF participated at all the scheduled weekly technical coordination meetings and ad-hoc meetings with Gavi and WHO. UNICEF regional office was also represented at the meetings. Scheduled meeting with MoPHP partners to discuss issues especially related to HSS3 support were supported and attended by UNICEF team. The meetings were opportunities for UNICEF to provide updates on the supports provided to the country in immunization supply chain management system, demand generation and contribution to Covid-19 vaccine deployment in the country. Global session conveyed by COVAX for countries were all attended by UNICEF team from Yemen and action points from all the coordination and special sessions were followed up

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Management - LMC
1) MNTE campaign implemented in the HRDs by the end of November 2019 with at least 70% coverage 2) 100% of VPD outbreak in the country adequately and timely responded to with at least 80% coverage

target.value: Technical support at the National and subnational levels for continued strengthening of Immunization related activities 1) Support planning and implementation of at least four integrated outreach. 2) Support planning and implementation of Polio and MNTE supplemental Immunization activities 3) Support capacity building of managers at governorate level on mono valent OPV (mOPVs) managment during polio OBR 4) Support planning and implementation of VPDs outbreak response. 5) Support capacity building of the health workers at facility and community level. 5.Coordination with partners including MoPHP, WHO, GAVI and other CSO. .

comment.narrative: MNTE campaign was implemented in the selected high risk districts in the South and a total of 308,126 women of child bearing age were vaccinated accounting for 68%. One of the draw back during the implementation of the fact that schools were not in session which usually provide opportunity to reach eligible school going girls in block

target.value: Technical support at the National and subnational levels for continued strengthening of Immunization related activities 1) Support planning and implementation of at least four integrated outreach. 2) Support planning and implementation of Polio and MNTE supplemental Immunization activities 3) Support capacity building of managers at governorate level on mono valent OPV (mOPVs) managment during polio OBR 4) Support planning and implementation of VPDs outbreak response. 5) Support capacity building of the health workers at facility and community level. 5.Coordination with partners including MoPHP, WHO, GAVI and other CSO. .

comment.narrative: MNTE campaign was implemented in the selected high risk districts in the South and a total of 308,126 women of child bearing age were vaccinated accounting for 68%. One of the draw back during the implementation of the fact that schools were not in session which usually provide opportunity to reach eligible school going girls in block

title.narrative: At least 50% of the 4,000 health facilities in 333 districts have comprehensive PHC microplan developed and in use for routine services

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement activities at the Governorate/district/sub district level with focus on Immunization coverage and equity 1) Support the development of integrated PHC microplan at Health facility level. 2) Support with country tailored strategy for implementation of the Reach Every Community Strategy in selected high risk governorte/district with high number of missed children 3) Support development of annual EPI operational plan for 2020

comment.narrative: UNICEF support with the development of the micro-plan template which was approved by MoPHP. However, funds available from Gavi for the micro-plan was for only 66 priority districts. The micro plan were completed in the 66 districts. UNICEF is supporting to monitor the availability and use of the micro-plan in the facilities and to support the scale up when resources are available

title.narrative: At least 5% reduction in missed children achieved in 2020 compared to same time in 2019.

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement activities at the Governorate/district/sub district level with focus on Immunization coverage and equity 1) Support the development of integrated PHC microplan at Health facility level. 2) Support with country tailored strategy for implementation of the Reach Every Community Strategy in selected high risk governorte/district with high number of missed children 3) Support development of annual EPI operational plan for 2020

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported three rounds of integrated outreach activities that contributed to catching up with children missed in the community due to COVID-19 pandemic and other factors. The three rounds of IoR contributed to take the coverage of Penta3 to about 87% against the 88% in 2019. From the administrative data, there was 29% reduction in the number that missed Penta 3 compared to 2019(193,201 in 2019 and 137,802 in 2020) and 64% reduction in children that missed Penta 1 compared to 2019 (133,921 in 2019 and 48,263 in 2020)

target.value: Strengthen government capacity to plan and implement activities at the Governorate/district/sub district level with focus on Immunization coverage and equity 1) Support the development of integrated PHC microplan at Health facility level. 2) Support with country tailored strategy for implementation of the Reach Every Community Strategy in selected high risk governorte/district with high number of missed children 3) Support development of annual EPI operational plan for 2020

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported three rounds of integrated outreach activities that contributed to catching up with children missed in the community due to COVID-19 pandemic and other factors. The three rounds of IoR contributed to take the coverage of Penta3 to about 87% against the 88% in 2019. From the administrative data, there was 29% reduction in the number that missed Penta 3 compared to 2019(193,201 in 2019 and 137,802 in 2020) and 64% reduction in children that missed Penta 1 compared to 2019 (133,921 in 2019 and 48,263 in 2020)

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
Vaccine availability secured and at least 3-5% of the population of Yemen (including Health workers, aged and people with co morbidity) vaccinated with covid vaccine

target.value: Technical support at the National and subnational levels for continued strengthening of Immunization related activities 1) Support planning and implementation of at least four integrated outreach one each quarter. 2) Support planning and implementation of Polio and MNTE supplemental Immunization activities by end of the year 3) Support introduction of new vaccine including phased introduction covid-19 Vaccine and introduction of second dose of IPV into RI program by end of Q2 4) Support planning and implementation of VPDs outbreak response. 5) Support capacity building of the health workers at facility and community level.

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported the country in 2021 to secure Covid-19 vaccine although there were challenges at some points. Covid-19 vaccine is readily available in Yemen with not less than a total of 1,368,800 doses of Covid-19 vaccine shipped to Yemen by the end of Nov. 2021 (including 817,600 doses of Astrazeneca, 151,200 doses of J&J and 400,000 doses of Sinovac). As at mid Nov. 2021 about 1.9% (576,012) of the population of Yemen had received at least one dose of Covid-19 vaccine. There has been challenge with vaccine uptake in Yemen as the deployment since commencement has been only in the South with about 30% of the country's population. Advocacy has continued to the authority in the North to come on board the vaccine deployment to improve uptake and protect the population.

title.narrative: One Polio campaign implemented by the end of June with at least 90% target reached.

target.value: Technical support at the National and subnational levels for continued strengthening of Immunization related activities 1) Support planning and implementation of at least four integrated outreach one each quarter. 2) Support planning and implementation of Polio and MNTE supplemental Immunization activities by end of the year 3) Support introduction of new vaccine including phased introduction covid-19 Vaccine and introduction of second dose of IPV into RI program by end of Q2 4) Support planning and implementation of VPDs outbreak response. 5) Support capacity building of the health workers at facility and community level.

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported the procurement and distribution of Polio vaccine and Vit A for the Polio campaign and Vit A supplementation which was implemented 29-31 May 2021. UNICEF also supported the communication and community engagement activities. UNICEF also supported the campaign with Third Party Monitoring (TPM) and supervision and monitoring by staff in the field and from the country office. The campaign which achieved 89% took place in the Northern governorate after so much delays and intense advocacy from UNICEF management and other partners

title.narrative: University of Oslo : Data
Covid-19 digital package installed

target.value: Support planning, configuration and management of COVID-19 surveillance

title.narrative: 1. EPI digital package installed 2. Data quality app installed 3. EPI legacy data migrated 4. Training given

target.value: Support transitioning to DHIS2 for EPI

title.narrative: Core team trained on COVID-19 digital data package and know how to use it.

target.value: Support planning, configuration and management of COVID-19 surveillance

title.narrative: Transition plan for EPI in place with agreed date for end of parallel system Costed scale up plan exist

target.value: Support transitioning to DHIS2 for EPI
